newsitem.title: ISRAEL: PLO's Arafat says Hamas leader to be freed soon.
newsitem.headline: PLO's Arafat says Hamas leader to be freed soon.

text.p: Palestinian President Yasser Arafat said on Sunday that Sheikh Ahmed Yassin, the blind spiritual leader of the militant Islamic group Hamas, would be released soon from an Israeli jail.

"I tell the shabiba (activists) that your brother Sheikh Ahmed Yassin will be released soon," Arafat told thousands of cheering Palestinians in Hebron during his first visit to the West Bank town which was given self-rule by Israel on Friday.
Standing above the crowd at the military headquarters held by Israel during 30 years of occupation, Arafat said the Jewish state would free Palestinian women prisoners "within a few days."
The release of prisoners, especially the wheelchair-bound Yassin, would shore up Arafat's support on the Palestinian street, including in Hebron, a stronghold of Moslem militant activism.
A U.S.-brokered peace deal between Arafat's Palestinian Authority and Israel reaffirmed an Israeli commitment made in a previous peace deal to release prisoners.
